casebody.data:
George P. Avery, Respondent v. William H. Jacob, Executor, etc., et al., Appellants. Decided May 4, 1891. Appeal by defendants from a judgment in favor of the plaintiff entered upon the report of a referee. E. Luther Hamilton, attorney, and Austen G. Fox of counsel, for appellants. E. H. Benn, for respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Freedman and McAdam, JJ.

Question of fact involved. The Court (Freedman, J., writing, Sedgwick, Ch. J., and *586McAdam J., concurring) affirmed the judgment, with costs, on the opinion of the referee.
